name: chopt
description: Chopt turns tree felling into a fair, server-safe timber experience. Break a single log with an axe and, after a few size-scaled swings, the whole tree comes down. What it adds: timber-style felling that counts required swings by trunk size (capped at 32 swings / 256 logs). Leaves proximity prevents player-built log piles from falling. Balanced gameplay: every swing costs durability; timbering only breaks as many logs as your axe can afford. Works with Efficiency/Unbreaking as usual. Multiplayer first: chop progress is shared per tree so multiple players can finish it together. Controls: crouch (Shift) to do a normal single-block break; final drop uses the original unstripped log state. Compatibility: Fabric 1.21.10, works with most modded tree shapes out of the box. Performance: chunk-safe scanning with hard caps to prevent runaway breaks. Requirements: Fabric Loader >=0.17.3, Fabric API for 1.21.10, Java 21. How to use: install on the server and client, break any log with an axe, keep swinging until the quota is met, and the rest of the tree falls.
